fractions.title: Fractions
fractions.description: Add, subtract, and find equivalent fractions with confidence.
fractions.bigIdea: A fraction tells how many equal parts we have out of a whole. Top = numerator (how many parts). Bottom = denominator (how many equal parts make 1 whole).
keyTakeaways: Always find a common denominator before adding or subtracting fractions.
Only add/subtract the numeratorsâ€”the denominator stays the same.
Simplify your final answer if possible.

negatives.title: Negative Numbers
negatives.description: Master adding, subtracting, and multiplying with negatives.
negatives.bigIdea: Negative numbers are numbers less than zero. Think of the number line as a road. Adding moves you right, subtracting moves you left.
keyTakeaways: Adding a negative is the same as subtracting a positive.
Subtracting a negative is the same as adding a positive.
Use the number line to visualize where you end up.

linear-equations.title: Linear Equations
linear-equations.description: Solve one-step and two-step equations like a pro.
linear-equations.bigIdea: An equation is like a balance scale. Whatever you do to one side, you must do to the other side to keep it balanced.
keyTakeaways: Whatever you do to one side, do to the other side.
Always check your answer by plugging it back in.

mixed-review.title: Mixed Review
mixed-review.description: Practice all topics together to strengthen your skills.
mixed-review.bigIdea: The best way to solidify your learning is to practice problems from different topics in random order.
keyTakeaways: Identify the problem type before solving.
Use the strategy specific to that topic.
Regular mixed practice builds lasting skills.
